sourceMeaningMnemonic:
If you <radical>say</radical> the <radical>lineup</radical> of your family members that have lived on this earth under the <radical>sun</radical>, you're really explaining your <kanji>genealogy</kanji>.

This kanji has a second meaning too. It means score, as in a musical score or sheet music. So if your sheet music <radical>say</radical>s the <radical>line up</radical> of chords, especially <radical>sun</radical>nny notes, that's the <kanji>score</kanji> of a song. Those sunny notes are loved by your ancestors.
meaningInfo: Say the line up of your family under the sun, then sing some sunny chords to match. You'll know your genealogy and a musical score!
readingMnemonic: If you can't tell the difference between your <kanji>genealogy</kanji> and a musical <kanji>score</kanji>, you're a <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>) and I can't help you. You aren't a fool, are you? You know the difference.
readingInfo: Your family genealogy and a musical score aren't even close to being the same thing. Memorize these or everyone will think you're a fool.
